net.consensys.cava.concurrent

Interface AsyncResult<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the result object.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CompletableAsyncResult<T>

    public interface AsyncResult<T>
    A result that will be available at a future time.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AsyncCompletion accept(java.util.function.BiConsumer<? super T,java.lang.Throwable> consumer)
      Returns a new completion that, when this result completes either normally or exceptionally, completes after executing the supplied function with this result's value and exception as arguments.
      static AsyncCompletion allOf(AsyncResult<?>... rs)
      Returns an AsyncCompletion that completes when all of the given results complete.
      static AsyncCompletion allOf(java.util.Collection<? extends AsyncResult<?>> rs)
      Returns an AsyncCompletion that completes when all of the given results complete.
      static AsyncCompletion allOf(java.util.stream.Stream<? extends AsyncResult<?>> rs)
      Returns an AsyncCompletion that completes when all of the given results complete.
      boolean cancel()
      Attempt to cancel execution of this task.
      static <T> AsyncResult<java.util.List<T>> combine(java.util.Collection<? extends AsyncResult<? extends T>> rs)
      Returns a result that completes when all of the given results complete.
      static <T> AsyncResult<java.util.List<T>> combine(java.util.stream.Stream<? extends AsyncResult<? extends T>> rs)
      Returns a result that completes when all of the given results complete.
      static <T> AsyncResult<T> completed(T value)
      Return an already completed result containing the given value.
      static <T> AsyncResult<T> exceptional(java.lang.Throwable ex)
      Return an already failed result, caused by the given exception.
      AsyncResult<T> exceptionally(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Throwable,? extends T> fn)
      Returns a new result that, when this result completes exceptionally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function with this result's exception as an argument.
      static <T> AsyncResult<T> executeBlocking(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor, java.util.function.Supplier<T> fn)
      Returns a result that, after the given blocking function executes asynchronously on an Executor and returns a result, completes when the returned result completes, with the same value or exception.
      static <T> AsyncResult<T> executeBlocking(java.util.function.Supplier<T> fn)
      Returns a result that, after the given blocking function executes asynchronously on ForkJoinPool.commonPool() and returns a result, completes when the returned result completes, with the same value or exception.
      static <T> AsyncResult<T> executeBlocking(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx, java.util.function.Supplier<T> fn)
      Returns a result that, after the given blocking function executes asynchronously on a vertx context and returns a result, completes when the returned result completes, with the same value or exception.
      static <T> AsyncResult<T> executeBlocking(io.vertx.core.WorkerExecutor executor, java.util.function.Supplier<T> fn)
      Returns a result that, after the given blocking function executes asynchronously on a vertx executor and returns a result, completes when the returned result completes, with the same value or exception.
      T get()
      Waits if necessary for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result.
      T get(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Waits if necessary for at most the given time for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result.
      <U> AsyncResult<U> handle(java.util.function.BiFunction<? super T,java.lang.Throwable,? extends U> fn)
      Returns a new result that, when this result completes either normally or exceptionally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function with this result's value and exception as arguments.
      static <T> CompletableAsyncResult<T> incomplete()
      Return an incomplete result, that can be later completed or failed.
      boolean isCancelled()
      Returns true if this task was cancelled before it completed normally.
      boolean isCompletedExceptionally()
      Returns true if completed exceptionally or cancelled.
      boolean isDone()
      Returns true if completed normally, completed exceptionally or cancelled.
      static <T> AsyncResult<T> runOnContext(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx, java.util.function.Supplier<? extends AsyncResult<T>> fn)
      Returns a result that, after the given function executes on a vertx context and returns a result, completes when the returned result completes, with the same value or exception.
      <U> AsyncResult<U> then(java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends AsyncResult<U>> fn)
      Returns a new result that, when this result completes normally, completes with the same value or exception as the result returned after executing the given function with this results value as an argument.
      AsyncCompletion thenAccept(java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> consumer)
      Returns a completion that, when this result completes normally, completes after executing the supplied consumer with this result's value as an argument.
      <U> AsyncCompletion thenAcceptBoth(AsyncResult<? extends U> other, java.util.function.BiConsumer<? super T,? super U> consumer)
      Returns a completion that, when this result and the other result both complete normally, completes after executing the supplied consumer with both this result's value and the value from the other result as arguments.
      <U> AsyncResult<U> thenApply(java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> fn)
      Returns a result that, when this result completes normally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function with this result's value as an argument.
      <U,V> AsyncResult<V> thenCombine(AsyncResult<? extends U> other, java.util.function.BiFunction<? super T,? super U,? extends V> fn)
      Returns a result that, when this result and the other result both complete normally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function with both this result's value and the value from the other result as arguments.
      AsyncCompletion thenCompose(java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends AsyncCompletion> fn)
      When this result completes normally, invokes the given function with the resulting value and obtains a new AsyncCompletion.
      AsyncCompletion thenRun(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Returns a new completion that, when this result completes normally, completes after given action is executed.
      <U> AsyncResult<U> thenSchedule(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx, java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends AsyncResult<U>> fn)
      Returns a new result that, when this result completes normally, completes with the same value or exception as the completion returned after executing the given function on the vertx context with this results value as an argument.
      <U> AsyncResult<U> thenScheduleApply(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx, java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> fn)
      Returns a result that, when this result completes normally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function on the vertx context with this result's value as an argument.
      <U> AsyncResult<U> thenScheduleBlockingApply(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx, java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> fn)
      Returns a result that, when this result completes normally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied blocking function on the vertx context with this result's value as an argument.
      <U> AsyncResult<U> thenScheduleBlockingApply(io.vertx.core.WorkerExecutor executor, java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> fn)
      Returns a result that, when this result completes normally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied blocking function on the vertx executor with this result's value as an argument.
      AsyncCompletion thenScheduleBlockingRun(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Returns a new completion that, when this result completes normally, completes after the given blocking action is executed on the vertx context.
      AsyncCompletion thenScheduleBlockingRun(io.vertx.core.WorkerExecutor executor, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Returns a new completion that, when this result completes normally, completes after the given blocking action is executed on the vertx executor.
      AsyncCompletion thenScheduleRun(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Returns a new completion that, when this result completes normally, completes after the given action is executed on the vertx context.
      AsyncResult<T> whenComplete(java.util.function.BiConsumer<? super T,? super java.lang.Throwable> action)
      Returns a new result that completes with the same value or exception as this result, after executing the given action with this result's value or exception.

        Return an already completed result containing the given value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value.
        Returns:
        A completed result.

      • exceptional

        static <T> AsyncResult<T> exceptional(java.lang.Throwable ex)
        Return an already failed result, caused by the given exception.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value that would be available if this result hadn't completed exceptionally.
        Parameters:
        ex - The exception.
        Returns:
        A failed result.

      • incomplete

        static <T> CompletableAsyncResult<T> incomplete()
        Return an incomplete result, that can be later completed or failed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value that this result will complete with.
        Returns:
        An incomplete result.

      • allOf

        static AsyncCompletion allOf(AsyncResult<?>... rs)
        Returns an AsyncCompletion that completes when all of the given results complete. If any results complete exceptionally, then the resulting completion also completes exceptionally.
        Parameters:
        rs - The results to combine.
        Returns:
        A completion.

        Parameters:
        rs - The results to combine.
        Returns:

      • runOnContext

        static <T> AsyncResult<T> runOnContext(io.vertx.core.Vertx vertx,
                                       java.util.function.Supplier<? extends AsyncResult<T>> fn)
        Returns a result that, after the given function executes on a vertx context and returns a result, completes when the returned result completes, with the same value or exception.

        Note that the given function is run directly on the context and should not block.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the returned result's value.
        Parameters:
        vertx - The vertx context.
        fn - The function returning a result.
        Returns:
        A new result.

                                          java.util.function.Supplier<T> fn)
        Returns a result that, after the given blocking function executes asynchronously on a vertx executor and returns a result, completes when the returned result completes, with the same value or exception.

      • isDone

        boolean isDone()
        Returns true if completed normally, completed exceptionally or cancelled.
        Returns:
        true if completed.

      • isCompletedExceptionally

        boolean isCompletedExceptionally()
        Returns true if completed exceptionally or cancelled.
        Returns:
        true if completed exceptionally or cancelled.

      • cancel

        boolean cancel()
        Attempt to cancel execution of this task.

        This attempt will fail if the task has already completed, has already been cancelled, or could not be cancelled for some other reason. If successful, and this task has not started when cancel is called, this task should never run.

        After this method returns, subsequent calls to isDone() will always return true. Subsequent calls to isCancelled() will always return true if this method returned true.

        Returns:
        true if this result transitioned to a cancelled state.

      • isCancelled

        boolean isCancelled()
        Returns true if this task was cancelled before it completed normally.
        Returns:
        true if completed.

      • get

        T get()
throws java.util.concurrent.CompletionException,
      java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits if necessary for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result.
        Returns:
        The computed result.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.CompletionException - If the computation threw an exception.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted while waiting.

      • get

        T get(long timeout,
      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
throws java.util.concurrent.CompletionException,
      java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
      java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits if necessary for at most the given time for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time to wait.
        unit - The time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        The computed result.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.CompletionException - If the computation threw an exception.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - If the wait timed out.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted while waiting.

        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the returned result's value.
        Parameters:
        fn - The function returning a new result.
        Returns:
        A new result.

        <U> AsyncCompletion thenAcceptBoth(AsyncResult<? extends U> other,
                                   java.util.function.BiConsumer<? super T,? super U> consumer)

        Parameters:

      • thenCombine

        <U,V> AsyncResult<V> thenCombine(AsyncResult<? extends U> other,
                                 java.util.function.BiFunction<? super T,? super U,? extends V> fn)
        Returns a result that, when this result and the other result both complete normally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function with both this result's value and the value from the other result as arguments.
        Type Parameters:

        V - The type of the value returned by the function.

        fn - The function to execute.
        Returns:
        A new result.

      • exceptionally

        AsyncResult<T> exceptionally(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Throwable,? extends T> fn)
        Returns a new result that, when this result completes exceptionally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function with this result's exception as an argument. Otherwise, if this result completes normally, then the returned result also completes normally with the same value.
        Parameters:
        fn - The function to execute.
        Returns:
        A new result.

      • whenComplete

        AsyncResult<T> whenComplete(java.util.function.BiConsumer<? super T,? super java.lang.Throwable> action)
        Returns a new result that completes with the same value or exception as this result, after executing the given action with this result's value or exception.

        Either the value or the exception supplied to the action will be null.

        Parameters:
        action - The action to execute.
        Returns:
        A new result.

      • handle

        <U> AsyncResult<U> handle(java.util.function.BiFunction<? super T,java.lang.Throwable,? extends U> fn)
        Returns a new result that, when this result completes either normally or exceptionally, completes with the value obtained from executing the supplied function with this result's value and exception as arguments.

        Either the value or the exception supplied to the function will be null.

        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the value returned from the function.
        Parameters:
        fn - The function to execute.
        Returns:
        A new result.

      • accept

        AsyncCompletion accept(java.util.function.BiConsumer<? super T,java.lang.Throwable> consumer)
        Returns a new completion that, when this result completes either normally or exceptionally, completes after executing the supplied function with this result's value and exception as arguments.

        Either the value or the exception supplied to the function will be null.

        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to execute.
        Returns:
        A completion.
